decks.notes: This deck focuses on using creatures with sacrifice and undying abilities, alongside powerful combo pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide, to create a toolbox-style strategy. The deck aims to generate value through sacrificing and recurring creatures, while also utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution to find key pieces. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements like Blood Artist and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the board. Overall, the deck emphasizes synergy and flexibility in assembling combos and outvaluing opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill cards and creatures to quickly deplete the opponent's library in order to win the game through the "mill" win condition. It includes cards like Archive Trap, Glimpse the Unthinkable, and Fractured Sanity to mill the opponent's deck, while also using cards like Drown in the Loch and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab to consistently mill the opponent's deck every turn. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent's library and win through the mill strategy.

The deck relies on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses mana fixing cards like Chromatic Sphere and Chromatic Star, along with ramp spells like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map, to help find key pieces. The deck controls the board with removal spells like Oblivion Stone and sweepers like All Is Dust, while also using powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile toolbox, tutoring up artifacts to answer specific threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize and Ephemerate, while also applying pressure with efficient and evasive creatures like Solitude and Dauthi Voidwalker. The goal is to control the early game with removal spells and hand disruption, then transition into a more aggressive midrange strategy in the later turns. Utilizing a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a proactive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines such as Narset, Parter of Veils. The key win condition comes from resolving The One Ring, which can provide a powerful advantage for the player. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the board until it can secure a victory through incremental advantage and powerful late-game plays.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on utilizing fast, efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. With cards like Grief and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand, along with powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt help to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Marsh Flats and Verdant Catacombs ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck combines aggression with disruption to secure victory in each game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of powerful spells and creatures in a 4c Control archetype. The deck focuses on card advantage, removal, and disruption to outlast opponents while generating value through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt, along with powerful finishers like Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a slower, more grindy game.
